ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

PermissibleValues.value: Intensive Care Unit (ICU) Hospital Inpatient Department
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Intensive Care Unit Hospital Inpatient Department

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intensive Care Unit Hospital Inpatient Department
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A health care facility unit that provides intensive care to critically ill patients and patients with complex medical problems who require constant monitoring or special therapy.: An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.: A patient who is residing in the hospital where he is being treated.: A specialized division of a large organization.

Concepts.definition: A health care facility unit that provides intensive care to critically ill patients and patients with complex medical problems who require constant monitoring or special therapy.
An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.
A patient who is residing in the hospital where he is being treated.
A specialized division of a large organization.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.: A patient who is residing in the hospital where he is being treated.: A specialized division of a large organization.

Concepts.definition: An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.
A patient who is residing in the hospital where he is being treated.
A specialized division of a large organization.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The use of telecommunications technology to provide, enhance, or expedite health care services, as by accessing off-site databases, linking clinics or physicians' offices to central hospitals, or transmitting x-rays or other diagnostic images for examination at another site. (Bartleby.com)

Concepts.definition: The use of telecommunications technology to provide, enhance, or expedite health care services, as by accessing off-site databases, linking clinics or physicians' offices to central hospitals, or transmitting x-rays or other diagnostic images for examination at another site. (Bartleby.com)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: E-mail is short for "electronic mail" and refers to composing, sending, and receiving messages over electronic communication systems. Most e-mail systems use the Internet.: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.: Persons who provides health care as part of their job responsibilities: or a person or organization who is licensed to supply health care.

Concepts.definition: E-mail is short for "electronic mail" and refers to composing, sending, and receiving messages over electronic communication systems. Most e-mail systems use the Internet.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
Persons who provides health care as part of their job responsibilities: or a person or organization who is licensed to supply health care.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Telephone Call To Health Care Provider

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Telephone Call To Health Care Provider
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Electronic equipment that converts sound into electrical signals that can be transmitted over distances and then converts received signals back into sounds.: Send a message or attempt to reach someone by radio, phone, etc.: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.: Persons who provides health care as part of their job responsibilities: or a person or organization who is licensed to supply health care.

Concepts.definition: Electronic equipment that converts sound into electrical signals that can be transmitted over distances and then converts received signals back into sounds.
Send a message or attempt to reach someone by radio, phone, etc.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
Persons who provides health care as part of their job responsibilities: or a person or organization who is licensed to supply health care.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The room or rooms in which the physician and staff provide patient care. The offices include all rooms in the physician's office suite.

Concepts.definition: A medical facility where a doctor sees and treats patients.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The section of a hospital or clinic staffed and equipped to provide immediate medical treatment.

Concepts.definition: The section of a hospital staffed and equipped to provide immediate medical treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.: A patient who comes to a healthcare facility for diagnosis or treatment but is not admitted for an overnight stay.: A specialized division of a large organization.

Concepts.definition: An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.
A patient who comes to a healthcare facility for diagnosis or treatment but is not admitted for an overnight stay.
A specialized division of a large organization.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
